intro: Cherleria tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leafed cherleria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
